intro: Romulea saldanhensis, commonly known as the Saldanha bulbous orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulb-like structure. The plant produces clusters of delicate, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
